results.content: It was a good run down for me as a seasoned CSS designer. I feel comfortable getting in and dealing with LESS files without issue.
results.content_html: It was a good run down for me as a seasoned CSS designer. I feel comfortable getting in and dealing with LESS files without issue.

results.content: A little bit quick in places, but overall a great introduction to LESS
results.content_html: A little bit quick in places, but overall a great introduction to LESS

results.content:
It was a nice basic course but spends too little time on setup. Part of the basics is setting up projects to use LESS and compilers which was a step the instructor intentionally glossed over. I was slowed down learning this course because I was told to stop, and learn how to set up grunt on my own somewhere else for the first time. I spent way too much time trying to figure it out on my own, then failing, when the teacher could have walked me through it just enough to set it up correctly. Had the teacher not mentioned CodeKit, I wouldn't have been able to proceed in the course from just this obstacle alone. If using compilers and task runners are an essential, standard, or requirement to using LESS, it should be walked through on how to set up the course file folder.

After all that though, it was a helpful overview. It helped me gain a grasp on what tools and possibilities are at my disposal with LESS which is good for me. Afterwards it did a little more to offer insight on technology I can't incorporate in my workflow but wish I could. I don't think it was very relevant to me now but interesting nonetheless.

results.content: Great little course - informative and some nice quick examples, and loved especially the extra mentions of things like Codekit (there really should be some Codekit lessons on Udemy!) and Emmet.

results.content: I think that the instructor is too fast... Its a good deal, because he doesn't permit that the content became boring. The course content is very rich and very easy to apply in real life. Congrats.

results.content: It's a great overview and introduction to LESS, doesn't go to deep into LESS's abilities but it at least acknowledges this and directs you to additional resources. It would've been nice if there were some additional real world examples for some of the things that were shown that wasn't shown how it could be valuable.
